subject: Re: Using Adaptit II
msgSnippet: Kingsley Unicode is your best bet. ThothUni also works, but is less pleasing to the eye. Last I saw, both of them are hosted in files section of this group.
messageBody:
Kingsley Unicode is your best bet. ThothUni also works, but is less pleasing to the eye. Last I saw, both of them are hosted in files section of this group. Also, which operating system do you use?

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "bobcruickshank@..." <bobcruickshank@...> wrote:
>
> Hi, I'm a new member. I have some questions to Tim on the above software.
> When I import your XB I only get blank boxes. What was your target font? I installed the Unicode version of Adaptit, would that cause the problem? I tried it with KingPlus fonts and s couple others, Segeo UI Quikscipt and Andale Mono Quikscript.
>
> I like the Adaptit tool. Please advise.
> BobC
>
